intro: Downingia bicornuta, commonly known as the two-horned Downingia, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Northwest of the United States. It belongs to the family Polemoniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive two-horned bracts that give it its common name. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers in shades of pink and white, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Downingia bicornuta thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and stream banks. It is a short-lived perennial that plays an important role in its native ecosystem.
